results.title: Moving mountains (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Tell the story of women in the coal mining town of Elkford, British Columbia and their attempts to get manual jobs in the open-pit coal mine. Many talk about their initial shyness and the pressure they felt to prove themselves on the trucks and bulldozers. A useful resource to aid discussion and analysis of the changing role of women in the workplace - particularly in relation to non-traditional roles.

results.title: Moving millions
results.creator_credit: Crown Film Unit, Central Office of Information, John Taylor and Noel Arthur
results.brief_description: Shows how the London transport system handles the millions of yearly passengers. Much of the film deals with behind-the-scenes activities such as the washing and overhaul of vehicles, the training of drivers and conductors, and the testing of new safety devices. Music by Lambert Williamson.

results.title: Moving in = Firstborn
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Jaffe-Lansing Productions, Witt, Thomas Productions, Paul Junger Witt, Tony Thomas, Ron Koslow and Michael Apted
results.brief_description: A story of relationships, love, loyalty and family - and intruders who upset the balance. Wendy (Teri Garr) is a young divorced mother with two sons, Jake (Christopher Collet) and Brian (Corey Haim). Mother and sons appear to cope reasonably well in their relationships towards one another with the usual generational disagreements and ups and downs all families face at one time or another. However, when Sam (Peter Weller) enters into Wendy’s life, the boys find themselves gradually being pushed aside as their mother’s interest in Sam turns increasingly to love. When Sam moves in, both Jake and Brian become suspicious of his motives and eventually it is up to Jake, as first born, to try and take control of a situation that is rapidly getting out of hand. Both boys are determined to protect their mother at all costs but for Jake it is a moment of confrontation and making choices. Contains some violent scenes. Cast also includes a very young Sarah Jessica Parker as Jake’s girlfriend, Lisa and Robert Downey Jr (also in his teens) as one of Jake’s friends, Lee.

results.title: Moving house
results.creator_credit: British Transport Films and Public Relations Films
results.brief_description: A family move from one house to another is one of those human experiences which are commonly regarded with foreboding. But if the operation is carried out by experienced and reliable moving-men there is no need for it to be a nightmare. The late Richard Massingham was invited to apply his highly personal technique to a problem for which the more solemn forms of documentary presentation would have been entirely inappropriate.

results.title: Moving big trees
results.creator_credit: World Wide Pictures and Pathe Pictures
results.brief_description: The Civic Trust (London) works to redress the loss of trees (generally due to urbanization and other development) by cheap and simple means. Describes the process from selection and preparation of trees to relocation.

results.title: Moving and lifting the disabled person
results.creator_credit: Gateway Film Productions and Robin Ridgeway
results.brief_description: One of the most serious problems facing a family having a disabled member is that of moving and lifting them satisfactorily. The disabled person can be moved without hurting the helper and with dignity and comfort to them. Presented by the Multiple Sclerosis Society of Great Britain and Northern Ireland.

results.title: Movietone news
results.brief_description: Movietone cinemagazine items include: A new series of fire extinguishers and fire prevention demonstrated; presentation of gallantry awards by the Duchess of Kent at the Royal National Lifeboat Institute; description of a new rescue boat; displays of English fashion for export; a report on cemetary damage by vandals at Basingstoke; footage of new “crazes” - surfsailing and surf-racing.

results.title: Movietone memories
results.creator_credit: Film World, Tru-Vu Pictures, Chris Oliver and Alec Morgan
results.brief_description: A unique time capsule of our country’s past as captured by the Movietone news crews from the early thirties though to the mid fifties. The headlines, our sporting achivements, the tragedies, and our nation’s often off-beat sense of humour.

results.title: Movies move people
results.brief_description: The world depends on information - films can do a great deal. They can support an idea or change one; they can give an insight into some experience; they can give an inside view of written things; they can be a diagram in motion; film is able to affect attitudes because it affects emotions - it’s a vehicle for the imagination; a method to make thought understood.

results.title: Movies learn to talk
results.creator_credit: Prudential Insurance Company of America, Columbia Broadcasting System, Kenco Films and Burton Benjamin
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Twentieth century”.
Traces the development of sound movies from early experiments with clumsy systems at the turn of the century to “The Jazz Singer” in 1927 and the polished and sophisticated sound film of today. Includes glimpses of film personalities and excerpts from silent and sound movies. Narrated by Walter Cronkite.
